availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Orr (Nicholas County, Kentucky, farmer, justice of the peace, sergeant and second lieutenant (C.S.A.) )

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, farmer, justice of the peace, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Martha A. McCormick Orr in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on August 6, 1845. Father of Pamelia Orr, Mary E. Orr, Thomas J. Orr, Franklin P. Orr, William V. Orr, Addie Orr, and Harvey Orr. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1850. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Nicholas County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Nicholas County in 1861. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as sergeant and second lieutenant from September 14, 1861, to August 3, 1864.

ab.bibl:

Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0066.
